intro: Appendicula malindangensis, commonly known as the Malindangensis appendicula, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in montane forest areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
